alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greensville, southeastern Mecklenburg, southeastern Lunenburg, southwestern Sussex, southern Dinwiddie and Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 915 PM EDT... At 824 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McKenney to near Lawrenceville to near Norlina. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Emporia, South Hill, Lawrenceville, McKenney, Brodnax, Purdy, Brunswick, Jarratt, La Crosse, Alberta, Stony Creek, Dundas, Carson, Radium, Barley, Gasburg, Ebony, Bacons Fork, Dolphin and Bowens Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Sussex
